Using wtp-all-inone-sdk-R-1.5.0 and Tomcat 5.0.18

When I add CredCriteria project to my Tomcat server, it adds
<Context docBase="CredCriteria" path="/credcriteria" reloadable="true" source="org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.server:CredCriteria"/> to server.xml and generates following exception when server is started:
SEVERE: Error starting static Resources
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Document base C:\eclipse 3.2 Web workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\webapps\CredCriteria does not exist or is not a readable directory
	at org.apache.naming.resources.FileDirContext.setDocBase(FileDirContext.java:185)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.resourcesStart(StandardContext.java:3858)

I can comment this out and manually add the following and it works (debugger breakpoints also work):
<Context docBase="c:/eclipse 3.2 Web workspace/CredCriteria" path="/credcriteria" reloadable="true"/>

Need to fix so adding a project to the server generates a context that works.

Note: Although this is a minor bug, it can be very time consuming to determine the cause/solution and fix manually.

Pointing to the workspace (c:/eclipse 3.2 Web workspace/CredCriteria) will fail in some situations since the workspace project doesn't always have the regular J2EE web structure in place. The relative path that it is pointing to when running (C:\eclipse 3.2 Web
workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\webapps\CredCriteria) should contain a published version of the entire module.

This works fine on my Tomcat 5.0.25. Can you check the second directory above to see whether the directory exists or if there are any problems with the contents?
